definition: officialdom/bureaucracy
surname Guan
government official/governmental/official/public/organ of the body/CL:個|个[ge4]
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
variant of 場|场[chang2]
variant of 場|场[chang3]
Observations on the Current State of Officialdom, late Qing novel by Li Baojia 李寶嘉|李宝嘉[Li3 Bao3 jia4]

sentences.english: Judging from Taoist thought, his intolerable Ren Zhen thought officialdom dark.
sentences.chinese: 从道家思想上看，他的任真思想无法忍受官场的黑暗。

sentences.english: Author Wang Yuewen is the focus of the national attention for his official theme in novel at present.
sentences.chinese: 当代作家王跃文以官场题材的小说受到国人的瞩目。

sentences.english: The anger of laid-off workers has long been one of officialdom's biggest worries.
sentences.chinese: 下岗职工的愤怒长期以来一直是官场最大的隐忧之一。

sentences.english: Chapter IV is about the weaknesses of the new era officialdom novels.
sentences.chinese: 第四章，新时期官场小说自身呈现的弱点。

sentences.english: Hongcun alley next to a small drainage throughout the village officialdom.
sentences.chinese: 宏村巷子旁有一条小渠官场整个村子。

sentences.english: Surmising the heart is the basic principle of officialdom.
sentences.chinese: 揣摩上心是官场的基本原则。

sentences.english: After his retirement from the official circle, where did Fan Li go?
sentences.chinese: 范蠡隐退官场之后到哪里去了呢？

sentences.english: Wang Yuewen official novels display us the absurd side of Chinese officialdom.
sentences.chinese: 王跃文的官场小说为我们呈现了中国官场荒诞的一面。

sentences.english: Wang Yuewen official novels display us the absurd side of Chinese officialdom.
sentences.chinese: 王跃文的官场小说为我们呈现了中国官场荒诞的一面。

sentences.english: He was repulsed by what he saw in the official circles.
sentences.chinese: 对于在官场中所看到的情景他深感厌恶。

sentences.english: Working in officialdom creates a pressure-cooker atmosphere, the  respondents said.
sentences.chinese: 受调查者们说，在官场供职犹如置身高压锅。

political circles
to take an official post/to become a government employee
North Korea-China
toadying for personal gain/to curry favor/to study in great depth
bureaucrat/bureaucracy/bureaucratic
to smooth whiskers and pat a horse's bottom (idiom); to use flatter to get what one wants/to toady/boot-licking
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
promote/promotion
to curry favor (idiom); playing up to those in power/social climbing
high official
influential officials/bigwigs
princelings, descendants of senior communist officials (PRC)
to be in a position of power
be smooth and slick (in establishing social relations)
lit. see the wind and set the helm (idiom); fig. to act pragmatically/to be flexible and take advantage of the situation
